Class Tn3270MessageReconstructor

java.lang.Object
ca.gc.cra.radar.infrastructure.protocol.tn3270.Tn3270MessageReconstructor
All Implemented Interfaces:
MessageReconstructor
public final class Tn3270MessageReconstructor extends Object implements MessageReconstructor
Reconstructs TN3270 Telnet records into high-level message events.

Handles host-first message ordering and Telnet negotiations. Not thread-safe.

Since:
RADAR 0.1-doc

  • Constructor Summary

    Tn3270MessageReconstructor(ClockPort clock, MetricsPort metrics)
    Creates a reconstructor bound to the supplied clock and metrics sink.

  • Constructor Details

    • Tn3270MessageReconstructor

      public Tn3270MessageReconstructor(ClockPort clock, MetricsPort metrics)
      Creates a reconstructor bound to the supplied clock and metrics sink.
      Parameters:
      clock - clock used for timestamping generated events
      metrics - metrics sink used to record TN3270 reconstruction statistics
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if clock or metrics is null
      Since:
      RADAR 0.1-doc

  • Method Details

    • onStart

      public void onStart()
      Initializes per-direction decoders and clears pending transactions.
      Specified by:
      onStart in interface MessageReconstructor
      Since:
      RADAR 0.1-doc
      Implementation Note:
      Resets Telnet decoders for client and server directions.

    • onBytes

      public List<MessageEvent> onBytes(ByteStream slice)
      Decodes incoming bytes into Telnet records and produces TN3270 message events.
      Specified by:
      onBytes in interface MessageReconstructor
      Parameters:
      slice - contiguous TCP bytes with orientation metadata; must not be null
      Returns:
      ordered list of reconstructed TN3270 messages; may be empty
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if slice is null
      Since:
      RADAR 0.1-doc
      Implementation Note:
      Splits Telnet records on IAC EOR boundaries and manages host-first transaction ids.

    • onClose

      public void onClose()
      Releases buffered state and clears pending transaction ids.
      Specified by:
      onClose in interface MessageReconstructor
      Since:
      RADAR 0.1-doc
      Implementation Note:
      Flushes Telnet decoder buffers to avoid cross-session leakage.
